reviews.review_msg: Ross is a super engaging lecturer and all around great guy. Landscape arch ended up being one of my favourite courses in my degree even though I'm not very interested in environmental arch. He has a lot of interesting ideas, you'll get a lot out of his courses if you engage with the readings and lectures and speak up in class.
Average prof at best. No matter how hard you work if you're not an Archaeology major you can never get even the least of As.

One of the best prof's I've taken in 6 years of college/university. Very understanding of students having other classes and will adjust his due dates if the class asks. Has weekly readings that has small in class activities worth a decent amount of your mark but they're pretty easy! Super funny, engaging and passionate about his work.
Not a hard class, but if you are not an archaeology major you get B+ the maximum. He favors the archaeology major students, the wierdiest thing I have ever seen.

I have taken three classes with Ross. He is very funny and laid back, which is mostly a good thing. He makes lectures fun and he marks very fairly. However, he never answers emails. If you have a question, make sure to ask him during class or office hours because he won't respond to emails. Also, he takes a super long time to mark stuff.
